intro: Polyosma gitingensis, commonly known as the Gitingen's polyosma, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found in lowland forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
